1 '''
2 Collection of functions that are useful for the robokeeper
3 '''
4 import numpy as np
5 from sklearn import linear_model
6 import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
7 from bagpy import bagreader
8 import pandas as pd
9 
10 def traj_linear_reg(x_train, y_train, x_goal):
11  '''Predicts the y position of the ball when it crosses the goal line by fitting
12  a line to the first few xy-positions of the ball
13 
14  Args:
15  x_train (list): x coordinate training data
16  y_train (list): y coordinate training data
17  x_goal (float): position of the goal on the x-axis
18 
19  Returns:
20  y_predict (float): predicted y postion of the ball when it crosses the goal
21  '''
22  # Format the input data for the linear regression model function
23  x_train = np.array([x_train]).T
24  y_train = np.array(y_train)
25 
26  # Compute linear regression model
27  reg = linear_model.LinearRegression()
28  reg.fit(x_train, y_train)
29  intercept = reg.intercept_
30  slope = reg.coef_
31 
32  # Now make the prediction
33  y_predict = intercept + slope*x_goal
34 
35  return y_predict[0]
36 
37 def joint_lookup_table(y_pos):
38  '''
39  Using the dictionary defined below, this function returns the joint angles that would result in
40  the end effector being positioned at the y-coord 'y_pos' along the goal plane
41 
42  Args:
43  y_pos (float): desired y-coord along the goal plane
44 
45  Returns:
46  list of joint angles [joint1, ..., joint6] that would accomplish moving the end effector to the desired y-coord
47  '''

101 
102  y_pos_cm = round(y_pos, 2)
103  if y_pos_cm > 0.25:
104  return lookup_dict[0.25]
105  elif y_pos_cm < -0.25:
106  return lookup_dict[-0.25]
107  return lookup_dict[y_pos_cm]
108 
109 def get_rosbag_data():
110  '''
111  Extracts position data stored in a rosbag file
112 
113  Only needed for testing
114  '''
115  bag = bagreader('subset_second.bag')
116  data_rosbag = bag.message_by_topic('/Goalie_coord')
117  data = pd.read_csv(data_rosbag)
118  return data
119 
120 def main():
121  '''
122  Main is just used to test the above functions
123  '''
124  data = get_rosbag_data().to_numpy()
125  x_data = data[:, 1]
126  y_data = data[:, 2]
127 
128  n = 10
129  x_train = x_data[0:n]
130  y_train = y_data[0:n]
131 
132  x_goal = -1.27 # As of Nov 21, 8pm
133  y_predict = traj_linear_reg(x_train, y_train, x_goal)
134 
135  joint_lookup_table(y_predict)
136 
137 if __name__ == '__main__':
138  main()
